A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Last Jedi is the most refreshing Star Wars film I have seen in a long time. I would rate it higher than Force Awakens and Rogue One\, and I actually liked Rogue One more than Force Awakens.

Unlike other Star Wars movies\, or modern movies today\, The Last Jedi isn't a mindless predictable story with explosions. There were several scenes in The Last Jedi that actually surprised me.

In most movies you can predict what will happen\, and usually follows the same boring formula: Some trigger happy jock is going to do something crazy and despite all odds is going to save the day. In The Last Jedi you had that character do that\, but ultimately fail\, leaving the rest of the cast to pull what ever they had left within themselves just to survive another day.

You also have a new character that gets discounted by trigger happy character because of "experience"\, but ultimately vindicated. With as little screen time this character had\, the way she was vindicated and ultimately saved them was astonishing. It actually made me feel something for the character\, which is something very hard to do with a character that new and short-lived.

I have several friends who have nit-picked this movie to death and had complaints about several scenes. I call bs. These same people think that Dead Pool is quality entertainment...
